title: BI Analyst
description:
Who we are:
Syte empowers the world's most innovative retailers in fashion, home decor and jewelry to grow revenues and brand loyalty with superior shopping experiences. Our mission is to redefine product discovery and change the way people shop, forever.
Our patented Visual-AI platform fuels various solutions for retailers including - Camera search, Contextual search, Recommendation engines, Deep tagging suite, In-store solutions, a Marketplace for consumers and more. The company was founded in 2015 and has raised $71M to date.
Now, we're looking for a BI Analyst to join us!
What you'll do:
Play a critical role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making within our organization.
Put a strong emphasis on understanding business needs, organization's KPIs, managing data workflows, and ensuring the reliability of data pipelines.
Work closely with cross-functional teams such as CS, Sales, Product, Management, R&D to gather requirements, analyze data, and communicate findings effectively.
Identify opportunities for leveraging data to improve business processes, drive efficiency, and support strategic initiatives.
Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines to ensure the timely and reliable delivery of data for analysis.
Monitor data pipelines for errors, anomalies, and performance issues, and take proactive measures to address them.
Bridge between business needs and technical requirements (how data is received vs what the BI needs to extract out of it)
Facilitate discussions to gather insights, align objectives, and ensure consensus among stakeholders.

Requirements:

What you’ll need:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
+3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst or BI Developer, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights to drive business value (e-commerce/ tech companies preferred)
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation
Extensive control in Python
Proven experience with data modeling: creating and optimizing complex data models in a big data environment using tools such as Rivery & Snowflake
Proficiency in Tableau and experience with advanced Excel functions
Experience analyzing A/B tests (GA or any A/B test tool) - Big advantage
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, with a keen attention to detail and a commitment to quality.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent English

Work from Home:
Hybrid Model
field_of_expertise: Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Modeling, Data Extraction, Data Manipulation
soft_skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills, Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, with a keen attention to detail and a commitment to quality.
technical_skills: SQL, Python, Rivery, Snowflake, Tableau, Excel

title: Data Analyst - Student
description:
What We're About
We're an experienced and diverse team focused on solving one of the biggest challenges Chief Information officers and Chief Information Security Officers have - allowing development teams to move fast without compromising on security controls and risk management. we're looking for strong and fun people to join us and take a significant part in shaping our technology, product, and culture.

What You're About
You are a second year computer science/electrical engineering student who is available for 60% part time work. You have strong communication skills, both Hebrew and English. You are passionate about technology and love working in a team. Being a part of an innovative and growing startup company is exactly what you're looking for! Prior experience is great but not required.

What You Will Do
You will explore common code technology frameworks across various programming languages, mostly security oriented.
You will create and maintain a dataset of technologies, frameworks and usages.You will research and define usage detectors for those frameworks and gradually take part in developing those mechanisms.
You will work closely with our data science and engineering teams to see how we show value for our customers.

**please attach a grade sheet**

title: Analyst
description:
At JFrog, we're reinventing DevOps to help the world's greatest companies innovate - and we want you along for the ride. This is a special place with a unique combination of brilliance, spirit, and just all-around great people. Here, if you're willing to do more, your career can take off. And since software plays a central role in everyone's lives, you'll be part of an important mission. Thousands of customers, including 75% of the Fortune 100, trust JFrog to manage, accelerate, and secure their software delivery from code to production - a concept we call "liquid software." Wouldn't it be amazing if you could join us in our journey?
JFrog is looking for an Analyst who plays a pivotal role in supporting strategic decision-making, business analysis, and organizational optimization. This position requires exceptional analytical skills, strategic thinking, and the ability to synthesize complex information into actionable insights. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, providing data-driven recommendations to drive business growth and operational efficiency.
As an Analyst in JFrog you will...
Conduct comprehensive analysis of market trends, competitor landscapes, and industry developments to provide insights that inform our CEO's strategic decisions.
Analyze financial statements, performance metrics, and key financial indicators to assess company performance and identify opportunities.
Develop and maintain dashboards and KPIs to monitor business performance across various departments. Provide regular updates to the CEO on key metrics and performance trends.
CEO projects Support: Assist in the planning and monitoring of initiatives and special projects initiated by the CEO office.
Communicate at the highest level effectively, preparing executive-level reports, presentations, and briefing materials for the CEO.
Collaborate flawlessly cross-functionally, interfacing with various departments, including Finance, Operations, Marketing, and Human Resources to gather data, analyze performance, and support strategic initiatives.
To be an Analyst in JFrog you need...
A Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or related field.
4 years' experience in business analysis, and financial analysis (experience with supporting executives is a key advantage).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and generate actionable insights.
Proficiency in financial modeling, statistical analysis, and data visualization tools.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical or complex information to a wide variety of stakeholders.
A strategic mindset with the ability to think critically and creatively to solve complex problems.
To be detail-oriented to support complex and/or highly confidential information.
The ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
Native or expert-level fluency in English both written and verbal.
A high proficiency in SQL, Excel, and BI tools (such as Tableau, etc.) highly desired
If you're passionate about driving strategic growth and making a meaningful impact, we invite you to join our team as an Analyst.
soft_skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical or complex information to a wide variety of stakeholders.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Octopol is a pioneer company that integrates statistics modules and algorithms with a passion to sports, mainly soccer.
We are looking for a data analyst to join our research department. The data analyst function will support several stakeholders in Octopol.
Working with the research team and be the one to look and understand the bigger picture.
Learning the data gathering mechanism.
Face and solve business problems by analyzing data and provide insights to the business, covering a range of topics.
Develop complex logic flows to identify predefined events and generate desired insights.
Support the researchers on their projects.
Responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business stake holders.
Research and integrate new tools and methods to enrich datasets.

Requirements:

Requirements
+2 years of experience as Data Analyst.
High hands-on SQL skills (SQL server)
programming skills (R or Python).
knowledge in statistics.

Added bonuses if you have:
interest in FinTech, Algo Trading – a big advantage.
interest in sports (soccer in particular)

title: Data Analyst
description:
We are Outbrain.

We’re one of the world’s largest content recommendation platforms, delighting audiences with engaging, personalized content recommendations while serving as the primary engagement partner and platform for the world’s top digital media companies.
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. The Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, organizing, and analyzing datasets to provide valuable insights and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in statistics, data visualization, and programming languages. They should also possess excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.

A day in the life
Collect and clean datasets from various sources.
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
Develop and maintain data models and dashboards to track key performance metrics.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide analytical support.
Present findings and insights to stakeholders through reports, presentations, and visualizations.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation to enhance data quality and efficiency.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and visualization.

What you’ll bring
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proven experience working with large datasets and conducting quantitative analysis.
Proficiency in SQL and one or more programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Experience with machine learning techniques is a plus.

More than snacks!
Nearby parking place is available
Short walking distance from Sapir train station
Expand your toolbox with our mentorship program and internal learning tools
Dog friendly office
Follow your passions, visit the music and game rooms
…and of course a fully stocked kitchen!

We Recommend #LifeAtOutbrain
Outbrain is an equal employment opportunity employer and committed to diversity and inclusion at all stages of recruitment and employment.
Our company culture is welcoming, dynamic, diverse, global, and built on top performance.
Did you know "trust" is one of our core values? We apply this value to our day-to-day by working collaboratively on a global scale. With managers and teammates often sitting in other countries and time zones, we value communication, patience, and open-mindedness to all cultural backgrounds. We encourage all ideas, and everyone gets a seat at the table!
Our team is made up of individuals who are approachable, resourceful, passionate, and proactive. We foster a sense of belonging through our Employee Resource Groups –employee-led groups in which we debate topics and drive change. From OB Green (environmental), OB WE (women empowerment), OB Good (charitable initiatives) to OB4E (diversity, equity, and inclusion), you’ll be able to share your passions with likeminded people.
Dive into the Outbrain experience via our Instagram account!
Hungry for more? Have a closer look at #LifeAtOutbrain exploring our company manifesto, Youtube channel , Outbrain Culture blog and social media channels Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn.
soft_skills: Communication, Teamwork, Attention to detail, Problem-solving
technical_skills: SQL, Python, R, Java, Tableau, Power BI

title: Data Analyst - Student Position
description:
We create a safe space for communities to thrive.
OpenWeb's mission is to improve the quality of conversations online, building a healthier web where content creators of all kinds are empowered to thrive. As a product company, OpenWeb partners with publishers and brands to build strong, direct relationships with their audiences.
OpenWeb's technology empowers its partners to build vibrant communities rooted in healthy conversations and robust social experiences. OpenWeb works with more than 1,000 top-tier publishers, hosting more than 100 million active users each month.
Founded in 2015, OpenWeb has more than 300 employees in New York City, Tel Aviv, Kyiv, San Diego, Canada, London, and Paris and is backed by world-class investors, including Georgian, Insight Partners, Entrée Capital, The New York Times, Samsung Next, Dentsu, and ScaleUp. To date, the company has raised $393 million in funding and is currently valued at $1.5 billion.
To learn more about OpenWeb's platform, visit OpenWeb.com, or follow @OpenWebHQ on LinkedIn and Twitter.

What You'll Do:
Data Collection and Cleansing: Assist in collecting and extracting data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and completeness. Collaborate with team members to clean and preprocess the data.
Data Analysis: Conduct basic data analysis tasks such as summarizing data, identifying trends, and performing descriptive statistics. Support the development of data models and analytical tools.
Data Visualization: Assist in creating data visualizations, graphs, and charts to communicate insights effectively.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and objectives. Communicate analysis findings in a clear and concise manner to team members.
Learning and Growth: Learn and stay updated with data analysis best practices and tools. Actively participate in training sessions and seek opportunities to expand your data analysis skills.
Documentation: Maintain documentation related to data sources, analysis processes, and findings.
You will report to the Data Analytics Team Lead

What You'll Bring:
Student for Industrial Engineering and Management, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a closely related discipline from a university or known College (with at least 12 months left to graduation) - a must
Basic knowledge of data manipulation and analysis tools, such as SQL, and Excel.
Availability for 2-3 working days a week – a must (flexible during the testing period)
Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving skills.
Detail-oriented nature with a focus on data accuracy.
Effective communication skills.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new data analysis techniques.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team.
Please add your grade sheet - A must

The OpenWeb Culture
We offer a dynamic and unconventional work environment that spans from NYC to London, France, Kyiv, and Tel Aviv, bringing together a diverse group of world-class and high-caliber techies, wordsmiths, entrepreneurs, and creative thinkers. We empower every individual across our global team to be a catalyst for change and strive to create a work environment where you can have the utmost autonomy over your role and projects from start to finish. If you want to join an innovative tech company where you can challenge yourself, have the freedom to own your work, and make a lasting impact, then you have a spot within our growing community!
OpenWeb is committed to building diverse teams and upholding an equal employment workplace that is free from discrimination. We hire amazing individuals regardless of their race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, pregnancy, medical conditions, genetic information, disability, or Veteran status.
Build your skills with us as you build a better web for everyone. Join us!
Also, we care about your privacy! Please take a moment to review OpenWeb's Privacy Practices.
soft_skills: Effective communication skills, Ability to work collaboratively in a team

title: Data Analyst
description:
You’re invited to Join Beach Bum, the greatest gaming family that brings a new twist to classic games by introducing them to the world of online casual games.

Responsibilities
Use the most advanced analytics and data mining techniques in the place where data, product and monetization meet:· Be the data and analytical lead on all kinds of projects, while working closely with Product & CRM teams.
Extract and analyze large and multi-dimensional datasets in gaming environment using a variety of BI tools.
Design, execute, measure and optimize the core business models.
Develop and run quantitative analysis, reports and more with the end goal of supporting our monetization efforts.
Identify business gaps and suggest solutions to impact the business KPIs.
Requirements
2 Years’ experience as Business analyst· Very strong analytical capabilities
Fully proficient in SQL – must
Strong Excel skills – must
Experience with Tableau – advantage
Build automated dashboards and reports to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding of key business metrics and players’ experience

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Ping Identity:
At Ping Identity, we believe in making digital experiences both secure and seamless for all users, without compromise. We call this digital freedom. And it's not just something we provide our customers. It's something that inspires our company. People don't come here to join a culture that's built on digital freedom. They come to cultivate it.
Our intelligent, cloud identity platform lets people shop, work, bank, and interact wherever and however they want. Without friction. Without fear.
While protecting digital identities is at the core of our technology, protecting individual identities is at the core of our culture. We champion every identity. One of our core values, Respect Diversity, reminds us to celebrate differences so you are empowered to bring your authentic self to work.
We're headquartered in Denver, Colorado and we have offices and employees around the globe. We serve the largest, most demanding enterprises worldwide, including more than half of the Fortune 100. At Ping Identity, we're changing the way people and businesses think about cybersecurity, digital experiences, and identity and access management.
As a Data Analyst You Will:
Work with the Data Scientist, Product Manager, and Engineering team to develop and validate advanced analytic techniques for security products.
Work with customer data to provide insights on the detection of PingOne Protect products and identify anomalies or suspicious patterns.
Respond to customers inquiries regarding risks and fraud in their system and provide strategies to mitigate them.
Manage efforts to enhance cyber insights and reporting from our products Lead proof of concepts end to end, from analyzing data to creating detection solutions and testing their accuracy.
Research external data sources that Ping Identity can use.
Clearly and concisely promote complex data analysis to various stakeholders, including non-technical, within and outside of Ping
You Have:
Minimum 2 years of industry experience as a Data Analyst in a cybersecurity or cyber research role- Must.
Relevant experience in the fraud industry – Advantage.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to process big datasets Hands-on experience with Python programming for data analysis and querying is essential.
Extensive knowledge of SQL and proficiency in writing complex SQL queries to extract and manipulate data.
Strong data storytelling and visualization skills are required.
The ability to effectively communicate insights from data analysis to various stakeholders.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Ability to work as an individual contributor and as part of a team Experience working with Product, and Develop Teams - Advantage.
Knowledge of Cybersecurity technologies and methodologies - Advantage.
Soft Skills:
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Self-learning.
Independence.
Team player.
Our Benefits:
Hybrid model
Parental Leave
Education reimbursement
Cooperative health insurance
Generous Holiday Gifts
10Bis account
Ping Identity is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
Life at Ping:
We believe in and facilitate a flexible, collaborative work environment. We're growing quickly, but remain true to the innovative, can-do startup values that got us here. Most importantly, we keep hiring talented, smart, fun, and genuinely nice people because that's who we want to succeed with every day.
Here are just a few of the things that make Ping special:
A company culture that empowers you to do your best work.
Employee Resource Groups that create a sense of belonging for everyone.
Regular company and team bonding events.
Competitive benefits and perks.
Global volunteering and community initiatives
Our Benefits:
Generous PTO & Holiday Schedule
Parental Leave
Progressive Healthcare Options
Retirement Programs
Opportunity for Education Reimbursement
Commuter Offset (Specific locations)
Ping is the collective sum of all our individual experiences, backgrounds and influences and we pride ourselves in growing and learning together. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone's individuality is respected and everyone has an Identity. In recruiting for new colleagues, we welcome the unique contributions you can bring and encourage you to be your best self.
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.
soft_skills:
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Self-learning.
Independence.
Team player.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Fireberry is an end-to-end business management platform tailored for business specific needs.
From marketing to sales to customer service, and more, Fireberry makes it easy for the entire business to work together.
Each department is powerful on its own, but together they can be explosive.
Fireberry was built from the ground up by developers who already knew back in 2011 that there had to be a better way to improve customer relations and decided to develop a software for every need aimed to keep customers delighted.
After conquering the local market with more than 2000 satisfied Israeli customers from various industries, we are ready to go global.
Are you up for the challenge?
As a Data Analyst in Fireberry you will…
Gather and organize data from internal and external sources, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Analyze data using statistical techniques and data visualization tools to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and monitor business metrics.
Collaborate with cross-departments teams to understand business requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.
Communicate management through clear and compelling presentations and reports.
Continuously evaluate and improve data quality and integrity processes.
‍
To be a Data Analyst in Fireberry you need…
5+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
Experience with statistical analysis and modeling techniques is a plus.
Certification in data analytics or related fields is desirable.
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Bilingual fluent in English and Hebrew

title: Sales and Marketing Data Analyst
description:
ControlUp is the market leader in the IT platform for Monitoring, Self-healing and Analyzing customers’ virtual environments, creating solutions that save IT organizations time, money, and stress.
We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Business Data Analyst to join our MIS and Business Operations team, with a focus on supporting marketing, sales, and product functions. The ideal candidate will be proficient in BI tools, and will be responsible for analysing data, developing data models, creating insightful reports and dashboards, and enabling data-driven decision-making processes across these departments.
Responsibilities:
Develop data models, reports, and dashboards to provide actionable insights to our organization, mainly to sales, marketing, and product teams.
Interpret data trends, patterns, and anomalies to inform strategic decisions.
Design, develop, and maintain BI solutions, optimizing tools and processes to enhance data accuracy and accessibility.
Integrate data from Salesforce, Marketo, product data sources, and Splunk into BI solutions.
Manage ETL processes to ensure seamless data flow between systems.
Collaborate with other departments to streamline data integration practices.
Provide strategic recommendations based on data analysis to support marketing campaigns, sales strategies, and product development.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field.
3+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or a related role within the Sales and Marketing field.
Minimum 3 years of experience in data analysis in a B2B SaaS company.
Experience with BI tools.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Familiarity with ETL processes and data warehousing.
Google Sheets / Excel advanced skills.
Proficiency in SQL, data modeling, and data visualization.
Experience with BI tools and software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Experience with Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery, and Looker Studio (previously Google Data Studio) – an advantage.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to handle multiple projects and meet deadlines.
field_of_expertise: Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, Sales and Marketing
soft_skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills, Ability to work independently and as part of a team, Strong attention to detail and organizational skills, Ability to handle multiple projects and meet deadlines
technical_skills: SQL, data modeling, data visualization, Tableau, Power BI, Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery, Looker Studio, Salesforce, Marketo, Splunk

title: Data Analyst
description:
Armis is looking for a few of the very best people in their field to join our A-team of big thinkers, doers, movers, and shakers. This unique opportunity truly offers the best of all worlds—start up culture, enterprise level benefits and security, and top pay for the industry. Got your attention yet? Good, keep reading, it only gets better.
Ok, so what exactly does Armis do?
Connected assets are growing at an explosive rate, across every industry and every geo. In today’s world of smart devices and BYOD, these assets come from every direction and are found in every possible environment and industry. And they’re critical to success for every enterprise. And because every single asset represents a very real potential vulnerability, they’re also the last line of defense against today’s sophisticated cyber criminals.
Armis gives companies of every size—across every industry and geo—complete asset visibility, contextual intelligence, and continuous security. We have partnerships and integrations with the planet’s leading tech and cybersecurity players. And we’re building an incredibly smart and diverse global team of thought-leading technologists, creative visionaries and proven game changers who are ready to take Armis to the next level.
Armis is a data driven company, possessing substantial amounts of versatile device and network related data. As a Data Analyst in the R&D group you will be deeply involved in development of Armis core mechanisms, providing measurements and dashboards to facilitate data driven product and development decisions, getting a deep understanding of Armis products and a close acquaintance with new data features and involvement in their enrollment. You will also be involved in research and explorations of new Integrations, dealing with uncertainty, constantly facing unfamiliar technologies.
In this role, you will need to know how to look for and utilize the small details in order to create the big picture, derive conclusions and provide data based recommendations. You will be working closely with multiple counterparts as part of a team. Love for raw data is also necessary, along with a keen sense of curiosity and eagerness to constantly learn.
Responsibilities include:
Provide complex data analysis to facilitate feature development and product decisions
Identify data issues that require special attention
Identify and fix data inconsistencies
Research and explorations of diverse APIs
A team player who understands that the only way to solve large problems is with teamwork and collaboration
Requirements:
3+ years of experience with extracting insights from data
Experience in SQL
Experience with cyber-security
Experience in project management
Experience with querying API - Advantage
Python scripting skills - Advantage
Good familiarity with networks, networking concepts and traffic - Advantage
Sense of ownership and responsibility
Excellent communication skills
Analytical mind and problem-solving attitude
Strong organizational skills
Proficiency in English
Join our awesome team if you’re:
Intelligent, hard-working, curious and quick learning individual. A detail-oriented person, who can see how to construct a huge building from small bricks and stones.
The choices you make in your career journey matter. You want to do interesting work in an important field while also having time to live your life, which is why we place so much value in your life-work balance. Armis sets you up for success with comprehensive health benefits, discretionary time off, paid holidays including monthly me days, and a highly inclusive and diverse workplace. Put your unique experiences and perspective to work in an environment where they will enable you to thrive, grow, and live your life with integrity.
Armis is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We never discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected (or not) status. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to submit satisfactory proof of identity and legal authorization.
soft_skills: Excellent communication skills, Analytical mind, Problem-solving attitude, Strong organizational skills, Love for raw data, Curiosity, Eagerness to constantly learn, Sense of ownership and responsibility, Detail-oriented

title: Junior Marketing Analyst - Jun 24
description:
Manage, report, optimize and maximize ROI on large scale digital media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Google, YouTube, Tiktok, Snap, X).
Analyze large scale data and develop strategies to improve performance, while scaling campaigns.
Constant conversion performance improvement by A/B testing ad copy, creative types and funnel experience.
Collaborate with the creative team on new marketing angles and ads.

Requirements:
University Degree (B.A. or B.Sc.), preferably with a GPA of 85 and above from analytical field (such as Industrial Engineering, Economics, Management and Marketing, Psychology, Mathematics, Statistics).
Excellent wording/vocabulary ability in Hebrew (English – an advantage).
High analytical ability (will be tested) and the ability to learn advanced analytical tools.
Able to multitask and prioritize among many competing needs in a fast-paced, fluid environment, and ensure delivery dates are met.
Creative thinking with an ability to come up with different ideas to the same problem.
Ability to drill down into details.
Excellent Excel skills is an advantage.
Team player.

Please attach your resume in English.

Business Unit:
Media

Remote/Hybrid:
Hybrid

title: DATA ANALYST
description:
DATA ANALYST?? אנחנו מחפשים אותך!!!

כאנאליסט תעזור ותתמוך בבניה וניהול מוצרי הליבה הדיגיטליים, תוך תמיכה בהמשכיות עסקית ,צמיחת החברה וסיפוק מענה לצרכי הלקוחות.

title: Data Analyst - DI
description:
At Similarweb, we're revolutionizing the way businesses interact with the digital world by revealing to them everything that happens online. Our cutting-edge platform and unique data empower over 4,300 customers globally, including industry giants like Google, eBay, and Adidas, to make game-changing decisions that drive their digital strategies.
In 2021, we went public on the New York Stock Exchange, and we haven't stopped growing since!
We're seeking a Data Analyst to join our team and enhance our Digital Insights group. Within this group, the Digital Insights Ops team is responsible for establishing and maintaining automated delivery processes for tailored reports to clients, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality data.
What does the day-to-day of a Data Analyst in Digital Insights look like:
Apply your scripting skills to create & maintain custom data pipelines using Airflow, ensuring seamless processing and delivery of client-specific data solutions.
Investigating data questions & concerns from clients, using Similarweb's huge data sets.
Utilize analytical and technical expertise to proactively identify data anomalies and develop effective quality assurance processes, for ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Partner with Engineering teams to establish an infrastructure to scale solutions.
Partner with Data Analytics teams to meet customer business needs.
This is the perfect job for someone who has:
Experience in Python & Spark scripting, along with an understanding of general coding principles and best practices.
Experience with Airflow, SQL - Big advantage.
Experience with Git, Databricks, AWS, Tableau - Advantage.
Team player, autodidact, fast learner, with excellent analytical and research skills.
Excellent verbal and communication skills in English.
Why you'll love being a Similarwebber:
